2.text: I beseech you to hear my words and to do penance.

3.text: Permit me, and I will speak, and afterwards, if you see fit, you can laugh at my words.

4.text: Is my dispute against man, so that I would have no reason to be discouraged?

5.text: Listen to me and be astonished, and place a finger over your mouth.

6.text: As for me, when I think it over, I am afraid, and trembling convulses my body.

7.text: Why then do the impious live, having been lifted up and strengthened with riches?

8.text: They see their offspring continue before them: a commotion of close relatives and of children’s children in their sight.

9.text: Their houses have been secure and peaceable, and there is no staff of God over them.

10.text: Their cattle have conceived and have not miscarried; their cow has given birth and is not deprived of her newborn.

11.text: Their little ones go out like a flock, and their children jump around playfully.

12.text: They take up the timbrel and the lyre, and they rejoice at the sound of the organ.

13.text: Their days are prolonged in wealth, yet, in an instant, they descend into hell.

14.text: Who has said to God, “Depart from us, for we do not want the knowledge of your ways.

15.text: Who is the Almighty that we should serve him? And how is it helpful to us if we pray to him?”

16.text: It is true that their good things are not in their power. May the counsel of the impious be far from me!

17.text: How often will the lamp of the wicked be extinguished, and a deluge overtake them, and how often will he distribute the afflictions of his wrath?

18.text: They will be like chaff before the face of the wind, and like ashes that the whirlwind scatters.

19.text: God will preserve the grief of the father for his sons, and, when he repays, then he will understand.

20.text: His eyes will see his own destruction, and he will drink from the wrath of the Almighty.

21.text: For what does he care what happens to his house after him, or if the number of its months are reduced by half?

22.text: Can anyone teach holy knowledge to God, who judges the exalted?

23.text: This one dies strong and healthy, rich and happy.

24.text: His gut is full of fat and his bones are moistened with marrow.

25.text: In truth, another dies in bitterness of soul, without any resources.

26.text: And yet they will sleep together in the dust, and worms will cover them.

27.text: Surely, I know your thoughts and your sinful judgments against me.

28.text: For you say, “Where is the house of the ruler, and where are the tabernacles of the impious?”

29.text: Ask any passerby whom you wish, and you will realize that he understands these same things:

30.text: that the evil-doer is reserved for the day of destruction, and he will be led to the day of wrath.

31.text: Who will reprove his way to his face, and who will repay him for what he has done?

32.text: He will be led to the tomb, and he will remain awake in the chaos of the dead.

33.text: He has been found acceptable to the banks of the River of Lamentation, and he will draw any man towards him, and there are countless before him.

34.text: Therefore, how long will you console me in vain, when your answer is shown to be repugnant to truth?
